Class Client

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
io.github.nan8279.jhttp.client.Client
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Client
extends java.lang.Thread
Handles requests from a client.

  • Constructor Details

    • Client

      public Client​(java.net.Socket socket, RequestManager manager) throws java.io.IOException
      Creates a new client. This should only be used internally.
      Parameters:
      socket - the socket that connects with the client.
      manager - the request manager.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when the socket returns an error.

  • Method Details

    • getCookies

      public java.util.ArrayList<Cookie> getCookies​(boolean withServerCookies)
      Parameters:
      withServerCookies - when true, this also returns the cookies made by the server.
      Returns:
      the cookies the client has.

    • getCookieHashmap

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getCookieHashmap​(boolean withServerCookies)
      Parameters:
      withServerCookies - when true, this also returns the cookies made by the server.
      Returns:
      the cookies the client has, in a hashmap.

    • setCookie

      public void setCookie​(Cookie cookie)
      Sets a cookie.
      Parameters:
      cookie - the cookie to set.

    • getIP

      public java.lang.String getIP()
      Returns:
      the IP of the client.

    • sendResponse

      public void sendResponse​(Response response, boolean log)
      This should only be used in special cases, since it interrupts the connection with the client. Return the response in a request handler instead.
      Parameters:
      response - the response to send.
      log - if the response should be logged.

    • sendResponse

      public void sendResponse​(Response response, RawRequest request, boolean log)
      This should only be used in special cases, since it interrupts the connection with the client. Return the response in a request handler instead. The difference between this method and sendResponse(Response, boolean) is that this also logs the request.
      Parameters:
      response - the response to send.
      request - the request the client made.
      log - if the response should be logged.

    • handleClient

      public void handleClient() throws java.io.IOException
      Handles the clients request. This should only be used internally.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an error occurs while handling the client.

    • run

      public void run()
      Should only be used internally.
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class java.lang.Thread
